59 /* Config settings */
60 #define CQ_NUM_SLICES 13U

62 /* Tx Channel Configuration */
63 #define TX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE (1U << 0U)
64 #define TX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE (1U << 1U)
65 #define TX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE (1U << 2U)
66 #define TX_CHANNEL_1_2_ENABLE (TX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | TX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE)
67 #define TX_CHANNEL_2_3_ENABLE (TX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE | TX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE)
68 #define TX_CHANNEL_1_3_ENABLE (TX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | TX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE)
69 #define TX_CHANNEL_1_2_3_ENABLE (TX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | TX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE | TX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE)
70 
71 /* Rx Channel Configuration */
72 #define RX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE (1U << 0U)
73 #define RX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE (1U << 1U)
74 #define RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE (1U << 2U)
75 #define RX_CHANNEL_4_ENABLE (1U << 3U)
76 #define RX_CHANNEL_1_2_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE)
77 #define RX_CHANNEL_1_3_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE)
78 #define RX_CHANNEL_1_4_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_4_ENABLE)
79 #define RX_CHANNEL_2_3_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE)
80 #define RX_CHANNEL_2_4_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_4_ENABLE)
81 #define RX_CHANNEL_3_4_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_4_ENABLE)
82 #define RX_CHANNEL_1_2_3_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE)
83 #define RX_CHANNEL_2_3_4_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_4_ENABLE)
84 #define RX_CHANNEL_1_3_4_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_4_ENABLE)
85 #define RX_CHANNEL_1_2_3_4_ENABLE (RX_CHANNEL_1_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_2_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_3_ENABLE | RX_CHANNEL_4_ENABLE)

181 #define PROFILE_HPFCORNER_FREQ2_VAL CHIRP_HPF2_CORNER_FREQ_350K
182 #define PROFILE_RX_GAIN_VAL (30U)

184 #define PROFILE_DIGOUT_SAMPLERATE_VAL2 12500U
185 #define PROFILE_ADC_SAMPLE_VAL (256U)
186 #define PROFILE_IDLE_TIME_VAL 1000U /* 10 usec */
187 #define PROFILE_IDLE_TIME_VAL_16_98us 1698U
188 #define PROFILE_IDLE_TIME_VAL_89_41us 8941U
189 #define PROFILE_RAMP_END_TIME_VAL 6500U /* 65 usec */
190 #define PROFILE_RAMP_END_TIME_VAL_67_04us 6704U
191 #define PROFILE_START_FREQ_VAL_60GHz (1497521874U)
192 #define PROFILE_START_FREQ_VAL (1435384036U)
193 #define PROFILE_START_FREQ_VAL_76_024GHz (1417190077U)
194 #define PROFILE_START_FREQ_VAL_76_5GHz (1426063360U)
195 #define PROFILE_TXOUT_POWER_BACKOFF (0U)
196 #define PROFILE_TXPHASESHIFTER_VAL (0U)
197 #define PROFILE_FREQ_SLOPE_VAL_60GHz 828U
198 #define PROFILE_FREQ_SLOPE_VAL 621U
199 #define PROFILE_FREQ_SLOPE_VAL_14001k 290U

201 #define PROFILE_TX_START_TIME_VAL_1us 100U

248 /* Bit manipulations */
249 #define GET_BIT_VALUE(data, noOfBits, location) ((((rlUInt32_t)(data)) >> (location)) &\
250  (((rlUInt32_t)((rlUInt32_t)1U << (noOfBits))) - (rlUInt32_t)1U))
251

253 /* Maximum number of start stop with reconfiguration in between*/
254 #define MMWAVELINK_TEST_MAX_NUM_STARTSTOP_RECONFIG 50
255 
256 /*Start/stop/reconfigure configuration*/
257 typedef struct dfpTestStartStopCfg
258 {
259  /* Number of startStop to be run without reconfiguration in between*/
260  uint32_t numStartStopNoReconfig;
261 
262  /* Number of startStop to be run with reconfiguration in between*/
263  uint32_t numStartStopReconfig;
264 
265  /* If numStartStopReconfig > 0, this array stores which test number to switch to after
266  each stop*/
267  uint32_t testNumberSwitchAfterStop[MMWAVELINK_TEST_MAX_NUM_STARTSTOP_RECONFIG];
268 
269 }dfpTestStartStopCfg_t;
270 
271 /*Test miscellaneous configuration*/
272 typedef struct dfpTestMiscCfg
273 {
274  /*Set to "true" if the device has the “Second digital temp sensor” (tmpDig1Sens in rlRfTempData_t).*/
275  bool dig1TempSensor;
276 
277  /*Set to "true" if this is a test with advanced frame.
278  Set to "false" if this is a test with legacy frame.*/
279  bool testAdvancedFrame;
280 
281  /*Number of latent fault API calls before frame start*/
282  uint32_t numLatentFaultBeforeFrameStart;
283 
284  /*Number of latent fault API calls after frame stop*/
285  uint32_t numLatentFaultAfterFrameStop;
286 
287  /* Indicates how many chirps configurations are used in the test*/
288  uint16_t numChirpConfigs;
289 
290  /* Indicates how many BPM chirp configs are used in the test.
291  Set it to zero if no BPM chirp configuration are used.*/
292  uint16_t numBpmChirpConfigs;
293 
294  /* Indicates how many profiles are configured for the test*/
295  uint16_t numProfiles;
296 
297  /* Bitmask indicating which monitoring features are expected to
298  generate a failure report and fail status flag*/
299  uint32_t failFeatureMask;
300 
301  /* Holds the expected status flag for the respective fail monitoring feature.
302  The value of the failed status flag depends on the induced failure.
303  For instance, suppose that for the temperature monitoring the anaTempThreshMax
304  was set such that it will fail, then the corresponding bit STATUS_ANA_TEMP_MAX
305  in the status flag for the temperature monitor report should be zero and this is
306  reflected in this array. The position for the temperature monitoring status flag
307  is failStatusFlag[MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TEMP]*/
308  uint32_t failStatusFlag[MMWAVELINK_TEST_MAX_NUM_MON];
309 }dfpTestMiscCfg_t;
310
